lead_paragraph: The Justice Department announced Wednesday that the city of Florence, Ky., would allow modified duty for pregnant employees and pay $135,000 in damages to two officers.

headline.print_headline: 2 Kentucky Police Officers Win Pregnancy Discrimination Case
headline.main: 2 Kentucky Police Officers Win Pregnancy Discrimination Case

snippet: The Justice Department announced Wednesday that the city of Florence, Ky., would allow modified duty for pregnant employees and pay $135,000 in damages to two officers....
abstract: Justice Dept announces agreement by city of Florence, Ky, to allow modified duty for pregnant police officers, and to pay $135,000 in damages to Officers Lyndi J Trischler and Samantha J Riley in pregnancy discrimination case; complaints filed with federal Equal Employment Opportunity Commission claiming pregnancy discrimination have risen sharply, from about 4,000 a year in the 1990s to more than 6,000 per year, but most do not prevail.
